div.p: J.L. Dodds
Truck Co # 8 = 23 Engrs
A.E.F.
Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson
Tennessee
U.S.A.
Vraincourt France
Dear Ellen:
Just received a letter from you. And was real good to here from you. This is some beautiful day just a little cold I can stand the cold if it wont rain.
You said you would give any thing to know where I am Well I am going to tell you I am about fifteen Miles northwest of Verdun in a little town by the name Vraincourt which is in the Argonne Forest
I know you have read of what the Yanks have done in Argonne I have been here for the last two months.
The drive started on sept 25, at 11p.m. I was out in My truck at the time and
I never will forget that day or that night rathes.
I had been hauling lumber out near the front lines and the Germans sure were shelling the road where I had to go.
I had almost gotten back to my Camp when the Americans started there drive This sure was some fight the Germans had held this forest for almost four years and they were ready for the fight

However the Americans were to strong for them and they soon began to retreat which they continued until the end of the war The engineers following the inf real close to repair the road so the art. could be brought up.
We worked Night and day for some time. I worked for 18 and 20 hours
and would go in and sleep while some one else would run the truck I was in L. Co=23= at that time but was soon transfered to Truck Co # 8=23.
It seems a little funny not to here the Art. firing away Now. But I am glad this thing is over for I am getting real home sick.

I have been on the front since the 11 of May. We were on the Lorraine front the Luneuelle sect. all the summer. You remember of me telling you about going to a town on sundays that was Baccarat it is in southern France
We all sure did hate to leave down there was quiet most of the time there. They would get in a little fight ever once in a while But nothing like they did around here.
I thank we will soon leave here I havent any idea where we will go. But do hope it to some sea port to start home. I am in the first American Army I believe they will be the first to go home.

I will try to tell you some thing about the country I have seen. We left the U.S. on saturday Night before easter sunday Landed in Brest France on 13 of april. Were in Brest three days and then left for Bordeaux France
I mean that is some city I would have liked to spent all My time there but only stayed there about two weeks then moved to Baccarat where I have told you about
I havent had a chance to see
murch of this country only in moving from place to place. There are lots of pretty places to see. I have seen some very pretty places in my moving I will have lots to talk about when I get home.

Guess Linn and Harold will write you where they are as the sencor will let us tell most ever thing Now. I know you was glad to see the shows open again. I would like to see any thing they call a show.
Orr is some poplar man over here. He get letters from Unknown girl from the states most ever day. He has been answering a letter from Bardwell Ky
to night. Said he never would get around to see them all
Guess when you get this will be Christmas Well just have a good time for me and I will do with out.
It is most bed time and I have to get up early. So will quit for this time. Write me real often
With lots of love
James L. Dodds
Truck Co#8= 23 Engrs
American Exp Forces
Via N Y. France
